subject: Critical Thinking
title: Karl Popper: Science Advances by Trying to Be Wrong
description: One-minute skill: Karl Popper: Science Advances by Trying to Be Wrong.

hook.text: What makes something 'scientific'? Not proof. Karl Popper said: science is defined by what COULD prove it wrong.

buildup.text: Popper's falsifiability criterion: a theory is scientific only if it makes predictions that could, in principle, be.

discovery.text: Einstein's relativity: it predicted light bending around the sun.

twist.text: Freudian psychology & Marxist history explain EVERYTHING â€“ no outcome could falsify them.

climax.text: The lesson for all thinking: if nothing could change your mind, your belief isn't based on evidence.

punchline.text: Real confidence says: 'Here's what would prove me wrong.' False confidence.

quiz.question: According to Popper, what makes a theory scientific?
options: It makes predictions that could, in principle, be shown to be false
